verses.verse: It is commonly reported that there is fornication among you and such fornication as is not even mentioned among the Gentiles that one should have his father's wife.
And you are proud of this and should have mourned instead, so that he who has done this deed might be removed from you.
For truly I--while absent in the body but present in spirit--have already judged, as if I were present, he who has done this thing.
In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, when you are gathered together along with my spirit and the power of the Lord Jesus Christ
to deliver such a one to Satan for the destruction of the flesh that the spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus.
Your rejoicing [in this] is not good. Don't you know that a little leaven leavens the whole lump of dough?
Therefore cleanse out this old leaven that you may be a fresh lump of dough since you are unleavened. For indeed Christ, our Passover, has been sacrificed for us.
Therefore let us keep the feast, not with old leaven or with the leaven of malice and wickedness but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.
I wrote to you in a letter not to associate with fornicators--
yet not in every way with the fornicators of this world, or with covetous, extortioners, or idolaters, for then you would need to go out of the world.
But now I have written to you not to associate with any, if any man who is called a brother is a fornicator, covetous, idolater, abusive, drunkard, or extortioner. Do not even eat with such a one.
It's none of my business to judge those outside [the church], don't you judge those who are within?
But those outside God judges. So therefore remove that wicked person from among yourselves.
